structure.unit: COUNTY ROAD ENGINEER AND MAINTENANCE OF PUBLIC ROADS

law.catch_line: Railroad companies not to obstruct county roads.
law.text: Every railroad company, including traction line companies, which obstructs any public road, shall as far as possible put the road so obstructed in as good condition at every crossing of the railroad as it was before the obstruction, within six (6) months after the completion of the construction, repair or use of the railroad.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4350.
